alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 12:10PM EDT until May 03 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. For the Androscoggin River...including Gorham, Rumford, Auburn... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Androscoggin River near Auburn. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, The parking lot behind Roak Block on Main Street in Auburn floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 10.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
